poem:
Title: Unseen Storm Within 

A whispered voice quakes in worn chambers,
illness cloaked in the psyche's shadow.
Doctors deal cards of blame and shift,
leaving the body's torment unacknowledged.

250,000 souls carrying unseen storms.
A scandal, woven in endurance and ignorance.
Let us not hide this truth under the euphemisms,
but hold it up, an ember in an age of enlightenment.
